title: Michael van Gerwen remains favourite to win World Grand Prix in second round contest
text:

The World Grand Prix is well underway as darts fans continue to enjoy an incredible season for the sport.

Michael van Gerwen comes into the competition as reigning champion and favourite by some distance after seeing off Jamie Hughes 2-1 in a best of 3 sets match in Dublin on Sunday with an average of 84.59.

He faces fellow Dutch-national Jeffrey de Zwaan after he beat Steve Beaton.

Meanwhile, second-favourite Rob Cross faces fellow Englishman and BDO champion Glen Durrant; Gary Anderson plays Chris Dobey and Peter Wright plays unseeded Jermaine Wattimena as the second round starts on Tuesday night.

The final is on Saturday (October 12) with a £110,000 prize money for the winner.

Here are the latest top five outright odds to win the contest with The Pools :

Michael van Gerwen - 8/5

Back him here

(Image: PA)

The favourite and reigning champion. Since Phil Taylor retiring and Raymond van Barneveld in poor form this season, Mighty Mike has grown to become the heavyweight in the professional darts scene and has won the World Championship, the Masters and Premier League Darts this season already.

The reigning champion has already seen off the unseeded Jamie Hughes in the first round and is 2/9 to beat de Zwaan.

Rob Cross - 7/1

Back him here

(Image: PA)

The world number two. The Voltage has improved in his second year in the PDC circuit after winning the World Matchplay and reaching the finals in the UK Open and Premier League Darts.

But 29-year-old Cross average of 87.75 saw Austrian Mensur Suljovic 2-1 in the first round and faces BDO champion Glen Durrant in the second round - where the Kent player is 4/6 to win on Wednesday night.

Peter Wright - 8/1

Back him here

(Image: Action Plus via Getty Images)

The Snakebite will be looking to do one-step better after losing to van Gerwen in the final 5-2.

The Scot is making his eight appearance in the competition and faces Jermaine Wattimena in the second round finale on Wednesday night.

Gary Anderson - 17/2

Back him here

(Image: PA Wire)

Anderson will hoping for a decent performance in the tournanment.

So far he reached the semi-final of the World Championship but only the fourth round in the UK Open and second round in the World Matchplay.

The Flying Scotsman will be frustrated with how things are going this season but faces Chris Dobey tonight and is a strong favourite to beat him at 3/10.

Nathan Aspinall - 11/1

Back him here
description: The Dutchman is favourite to win his fifth World Grand Prix and his first successive win
